definition[0]: the object form of ‘who’, used especially in formal speech or writing
example[0]: Desperate for money, she called her sister, whom she hadn’t spoken to in 20 years.
example[1]: She brought with her three friends, none of whom I had ever met before.
explanation[0]: In everyday spoken or written English, people usually use who rather than whom:
example[2]: Who did you send it to?
